channel.title: Sven Eisenschmidt - Personal Blog
channel.description: Personal website of Sven Eisenschmidt, based in Leipzig, Germany.

item.title: Mine
item.description: Tilian and me went to take pictures of the ‘open-cast mining ground’ close to our village. (72 more words)

item.title: So I built an RSS Reader (Pt.2)
item.description: Two weeks ago I wrote about building an RSS reader. I said it would probably crash with more than 20 feeds (or I lose motivation). It didn’t crash but I needed to optimize it a bit. (1489 more words)

item.title: Frost
item.description: Last night’s frost laid a soft film over all surfaces. (137 more words)

item.title: New Camera Day
item.description: The Sony RX100 VII is here! I took it out for a spin with the kids to the forest and the garage of my father. There is so much to learn about it. (173 more words)

item.title: Disappointed
item.description: The Sony RX100 VII did not arrive today. I rescheduled delivery from yesterday to today because of my work trip this week. Not sure what happened for it not to arrive but I’m disappointed. (40 more words)

item.title: Death of A Unicorn (6/10)
item.description: Spoon-fed satire. The film explains every joke and theme twice, just in case you weren’t paying attention. A24 on autopilot that would’ve worked better as a 20-minute short.

item.title: Back
item.description: Completed my trip back home today. Did twice 450km within 24 hours. The VW California is such a comfortable car for long trips. (101 more words)

item.title: Away
item.description: Tilian is sick and Kellin has been quarantined as a precaution. I am on a work trip to Munich so it was extra difficult to leave them until tomorrow night. (83 more words)

item.title: Windpark
item.description: We have a new windpark north of our village. 250m high wind mills. The moon illusion hits hard with them, they overshadow the village from one end, and look tiny from the closer end. Strange to see. (16 more words)

Got two Speed Champion BTTF sets (#77256) for the boys. We watched the first two movies over the holidays for the first time with them and they loved it. Coincidentally Lego released this set January 1st. (41 more words)

item.title: Last Day Off
item.description: Vacation is over and I’m officially back at work tomorrow. A few impressions from today. (80 more words)

item.title: Craspedia globosa
item.description: Taken in our garden. […]Craspedia is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae commonly known as billy buttons, billy balls, and woollyheads. They are native to Australia and New Zealand where they grow in a variety of habitats from sea level to the Southern Alps.[…] (Wikipedia) - I’d would have called them yellow balls. (16 more words)

item.title: Vet
item.description: Neither Aika nor I woke up this morning and thought “Hey let’s rip out a toe nail, that sounds like fun!”. Yet here we are and we spent this afternoon at the vet. (68 more words)

item.title: Snow
item.description: First proper snow this season. The boys loved it. Aika was slightly annoyed. (16 more words)

item.title: So I built an RSS Reader
item.description: So I built an RSS reader. I wanted something simple for myself. Read my feeds, mark things as read, move on. (434 more words)

item.title: Eddington (7/10)
item.description: Chaotic like the last few years themselves it tries to capture. Surprisingly resonated with me, despite being very US-centric.

item.title: Reading
item.description: I don’t read enough books. I manage reading a few pages maybe one evening every two weeks. I can turn on something on Youtube or a podcast in the car without thinking. A book I have to actively pick up. (333 more words)

item.title: Sourdough
item.description: My wife started baking bread. Here’s her spelt (Deutsch: Dinkel) sourdough recipe. It took quite a few iterations to get it right. (190 more words)

item.title: Chicken
item.description: When I went out with Aika, I caught two of our four chickens in the garden. We have two Silkie chickens and two feather-footed dwarf chickens. The whole family loves them, and two eggs a day is a nice bonus. (116 more words)

item.title: Building This Website with Hugo
item.description: This website runs on Hugo, a static site generator written in Go. I launched it in early January 2026, so if you’re reading this when it’s fresh, this is all just a few days old. This post documents how I built it. (1731 more words)

item.title: Winter Walk
item.description: A winter walk with Tilian and Aika. The fresh snow melted during the day but froze overnight, leaving icy patches everywhere. Plenty of slipping and sliding along the way, with the kids landing on their backsides more than once. Aika seemed completely unfazed. (61 more words)

item.title: Tron: Ares (5/10)
item.description: Feels like they built a movie around a soundtrack. I knew it was questionable renting it and still left disappointed by its lack of substance. The 3D printing and digitization of matter was the coolest bit.

item.title: 2025 Wrapped
item.description: My year 2025 in numbers and highlights, wrapped-style. First attempt at summarizing an eventful year. More platforms offering wrapped/replay summaries obviously helped. (1889 more words)

item.title: Death Stranding 2
item.description: Over the Xmas period I managed to finish Death Stranding 2. The game is a perfect mix between logistics, base building and shooter action for me.I like it more than the Metal Gear Solid games. (199 more words)

item.title: Open Source
item.description: At the end of 2025 I spent 100 hours on a single open source project. I did similar things over the past twenty years but always lost interest. This time was different. The software is actually used at my company. Spoiler: I will happily discontinue it. (219 more words)

item.title: Hello
item.description: Welcome to my website. I work as Chief Technology & Product Officer at roadsurfer, where we help people explore the world in campervans. (23 more words)

item.title: Stranger Things (Season 5) (6/10)
item.description: Each season felt like it had a different plan for the next. The finale was sentimental but without weight. Dark and 1899 did this better.
